intro: Calymenia viscosa, commonly known as the sticky calymenia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Calymenia viscosa is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in woodlands and along stream banks.
